PROJECT:
FLOATING SLAB
425 NORTH ROAD GABRIOLA, BC
CLIENT:
MICHAEL SPEERS
DRAWING TITLE:
NOTES & PLAN
DRAWN BY: CC DATE: 2025-01-16
DESIGN BY: NA SHEET NO:
SCALE: AS NOTED
PROJECT NO:
25-01-069
pages.general_notes_verbatim:
GENERAL NOTES:
FOUNDATIONS:
1. REMOVE ALL TOPSOIL AND ORGANIC MATERIAL FROM THE BUILDING AREA.
2. SLAB MUST BE CARRIED DOWN TO NATURAL, UNDISTURBED SOIL CAPABLE OF SUSTAINING 1500 PSF ALLOWABLE BEARING PRESSURE OR 3000 PSF (150 kPa) ALLOWABLE BEARING PRESSURE, UNDER THE FOOTINGS.
3. IF FILL IS TO BE BUILT UP, GRANULAR FILL IS TO BE USED TO A COMPACTION MAXIMUM OF 98% SPD. FILL IS TO BE APPROVED BY GEOTECHNICAL ENGINEER.
4. ENGINEER WILL DESIGN ANY FOUNDATIONS FOLLOWING GEOTECHNICAL REPORT.
5. UNLESS NOTED, NO FOUNDATION WALLS ARE REQUIRED.
6. SHORING IS MANDATORY. IF NOT INSTALLED, CLIENT CONTRACTOR ACCEPTS THE POTENTIAL OF CRACKING/HEAVING (EVEN IF BUILDING IS NOT HEATED) TO HEAT LOSS OF BUILDING (IF HEATED).
7. PERIMETER DRAINAGE IS NOT REQUIRED. CLIENT CONTRACTOR ACCEPTS THE POTENTIAL OF WATER IN BASEMENT.
8. SLAB IS ON STRUCTURE. BRICK VENEER MAY BE USED UP TO MAXIMUM OF 4'0" ABOVE SLAB.
CLIENT CONTRACTOR TO CONFORM SLAB DIMENSIONS BEFORE ORDERING MATERIAL & CONSTRUCTION.
CONCRETE:
1. ALL CONCRETE ON THIS PROJECT SHALL HAVE A MINIMUM OF 20 DAY COMPRESSIVE STRENGTH OF 32 MPa WITH 19mm AGGREGATE AND 0.40 MAX WATER-TO-CEMENT RATIO.
2. ALL REINFORCEMENT TO BE GRADE 400.
3. REBAR TO BE INSTALLED TO BAR LAP.
WELDED WIRE MESH 152mm x 152mm x 10M.
4. ALL CONCRETE WORK SHALL BE CARRIED OUT IN ACCORDANCE TO THE LATEST EDITION OF THE NATIONAL BUILDING CODE OF CANADA 2015 AND ACI 301, ACI 318, ACI 347.
5. CONCRETE SHALL BE IN CONTACT WITH EARTH (I.E. FOOTINGS).
6. a) WHERE CONCRETE IS IN CONTACT WITH EARTH (I.E. FOOTINGS).
 b) WHERE CONCRETE IS IN CONTACT WITH EARTH (I.E. SIDE OF THE FLOATING SLAB).
7. SLAB-ON-GRADE MATERIAL TO BE MIN. OF 6" GRANULAR FILL (COMPACTED TO 95% SPD) ON CLAY OR SAND BASE.
8. SLOPE GRADE AWAY FROM BUILDING.
9. SAW CUT SLAB TO A DEPTH OF SLAB THICKNESS (1/2"). SPACE SAW CUTS @ 15' o.c.
10. SLAB IS NOT TO BE POURED IN FREEZING CONDITIONS.
11. SLIP JOINTS RECOMMENDED FOR ALL UTILITY CONNECTIONS.
REVIEW OF FLOATING SLABS:

pages.page_overview_summary: This sheet provides a detailed plan and notes for a slab-on-grade foundation, primarily for a floating slab. It includes general notes on foundations and concrete, specifying materials, construction methods, and conditions for the slab. The drawing features a plan view of the slab-on-grade and section details illustrating construction methods. Key components include the slab-on-grade foundation and associated structural notes. The sheet is intended for the foundation level of the building.
